definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: In ancient times it was etiquette to present your full-size visiting card when giving someone a gift.
sentences.chinese: 古時候，送禮物時附上自己的名帖，是一種禮儀。

sentences.english: Use wire or tape to attach your silk flowers to the container.
sentences.chinese: 用鐵絲或膠帶附上您的絹花到容器。

sentences.english: We enclose a catalogue for your reference.
sentences.chinese: 隨函附上一份目錄供你方參考。

sentences.english: Attached is the job descriptions for the Sales Officer in Beijing FMCG industry.
sentences.chinese: 在北京FMCG產業附上工作說明爲銷售官員。

sentences.english: I am enclosing a check for$125 as payment in full.
sentences.chinese: 茲附上一百二十五元支票一張作爲全部的付款。

sentences.english: Enclosed is my resume, and hoping for your immediate reply.
sentences.chinese: 簡歷隨信附上，希望早獲迴音。
隨函附上我們最新的商品目錄。

sentences.english: Original receipts must be presented before redemption at Neways Singapore Product Showcase.
sentences.chinese: 在領取贈品時必需附上收據。

sentences.english: The amounts they sent were smaller, the notes that accompanied them more inquisitive.
sentences.chinese: 這些學生寄來的錢很少，附上的短信更加刨根問底。

sentences.english: Enclosed is some additional technical information on the probers.
sentences.chinese: 茲附上探測器之附加技術資料。

sentences.english: We are pleased to send you herewith attached Sample-Cuttings of Cotton Shirting and Sheeting.
sentences.chinese: 我方隨函附上棉布襯衫衣料與被單料的樣品片。

sentences.english: Enclosed is the duplication of our countersigned sales contract.
sentences.chinese: 隨函附上業經我方會籤的銷售合同。

sentences.english: I have attached a copy of the report to this email.
sentences.chinese: 我已經在此電子郵件中附上一份報告。

sentences.english: Dave says 'I'm attaching two photos of Balut.
sentences.chinese: 戴維說“我附上了兩張巴魯特的照片。

sentences.english: I have attached the correct one for your ref.
sentences.chinese: 我已附上正確的一份供你參考。

sentences.english: Enclosed you will find a copy of pricelist.
sentences.chinese: 茲隨函附上價目表一份，請查收。

definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
to include (as a free gift, when buying sth)/to come with
to transmit/to dispatch/to issue (an official document or credential)
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
to mark out/to tag/to put a sign on sth explaining or calling attention to/to annotate (e.g. a character with its pinyin)
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
